text:
I am having some issues with passing the date to HubSpot. Reading about the recent standardization <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog/new-standardization-of-date-formats-for-HubSpots-form-submissions-api#:~:text=Starting%20Tuesday%2C%20November%2030th%2C%202022,be%202022%2D05%2D16)|here> it seems that the date either needs to be in YYYY-MM-DD format or a unix timestamp.
We are an integration developer. Is there no way for us to send the date to HubSpot in one format without knowing which date format every user account would accept?
Basically only use Epoc Millisecond, thats the only one you should use
So that should work in every case? I am having an issue with one particular customer where it doesn't accept it. Unless I am doing something wrong somewhere else.
Yeah it should have no issue, just make sure that if it's a date property set it to midnight of the day you want if it's a datetime property set it to whatever date and time you want
Most every property is date and not datetime
Hey all, is it possible to clone/stage website pages through the CLI tool?
